intro: Silene lemmonii, commonly known as Lemmon's campion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its stems are usually erect and branched, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Silene lemmonii is adapted to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
